column2: pron. {{IPA|[ˈilmen]}}) was a part of the atmosphere that surrounded the world of [[Arda]]
column3: the region of airs where the [[stars]] are.

column1: Flesh can't survive the airs above Ilmen unaided. The [[Straight Road]] however traverses Ilmen.<ref>{{S|Akallabeth}}</ref>
The [[Moon]] passed through Ilmen on its way around the world
column2: plunging down the [[Chasm of Ilmen]] on its way back.{{fact}}

column1: [[Christopher Tolkien]] has noted that ''Ilmen'' is related to such words as ''[[Ilmarë]]'' and ''[[Ilmarin]]''<ref>{{S|Elements}}

column2: Ilmen is derived from the [[root]] [[GIL]] signifying "the region above air where stars are".<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}

column1: In the early schematic titled ''[[I Vene Kemen]]''
column2: the middle layer of airs was marked as ''Ilwe'' ([[Qenya]]).
Ilmen formed the outer layer of normal air
column3: inside [[Vaiya]] and it was enclosed between the [[Mountains of Valinor]] and the [[Walls of the Sun]] mountains beyond the [[Eastern Sea]]. Below and inside Ilmen was the inner air

column1: Ilmen is the level of the [[Sun]]
column2: the [[Moon]] and the [[Stars]] so it was also called ''Tinwe-malle'' (star-street) and ''[[Elenarda (disambiguation)|Elenarda]]'' (Stellar Kingdom).<ref>{{SM|Ambar}}
